intro: Randia humboldtiana, commonly known as the Humboldt randia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments. The fruit is a small, fleshy drupe that contains several seeds.
